Tom Emerson wrote:

>I am running a crawl on a vanilla 1.1 installation with the
>ContentTypeRegExpFilter over a Japanese site.
>  
>
>According to the crawl report, over 21K HTML documents have been
>downloaded. I have a ContentTypeRegExpFilter on the ARC writer
>limiting the types saved to text/html. Indeed, this same order is
>being used in another Heritrix instance (a clone of this) without any
>problems.
>
>  
>
>However, when I look on disk, the ARC file contains only 7
>records. The other 21K or so are disappearing into the ether: the logs
>show nothing out of the ordinary, the information is just getting lost
>somewhere.
>
>As I said, I have a clone of this running on another port and it is
>happily saving tens of thousands of documents into the ARC files. This
>is weird.
>  
>
Yes.

Diff of order files doesn't show anything different?

St.Ack

>I'm going to try some things on my side, but I wanted to ping the list
>and see if anyone has any ideas.
>  
>

>    -tree
>
>  
>
